issue.title: admin: UI glitch in debug-information
issue.body:
**Specifics of your environment**
N/A

**Describe the bug**
When testing an auhtsource from the admin-pages, an overview of attributes is shown. Underneath is also 'Debug information' with a json-array. Complex attributes like `eduPersonTargetedID` are shown there as an empty array

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to admin pages
2. Test an authsource that releases a complex attribute.
3. Scroll down to 'Debug information'
4. See the empty array as attribute-value

**Expected behavior**
The complex content should somehow be displayed

**Screenshots or logs**
![afbeelding](https://github.com/simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp/assets/841045/9c15c042-1ff5-4550-b53a-2180099bb55f)

**Additional context**
N/A

issue.title: Error Installing 2.1RC
issue.body:
I'm working in a local docker development environment, testing an upgrade to Drupal 10. When trying to actually perform the upgrade, I get the following error, which seems to be related to this code:

`Unable to install module simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-assets-base, package name must be on the form "VENDOR/simplesamlphp-module-MODULENAME".`

I believe this error is being generated by composer v2.

commits.message: Try and get a more consistent output by sorting the Twig-translations alphabetically

issue.title: Composer install does not install simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-assets-base
issue.body:
I have installed SimpleSAMLphp 2.1rc1 on a Drupal installation with dependencies managed via composer. 

I have the following in the root composer.json

        "simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp": "*",
        "simplesamlphp/composer-module-installer": "*",
        "simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-assets-base": "*",

The first composer install command does not install assets/base/* into the public folder. This however gets installed when you run composer install the second time.

I was able to work around this by using a composer post-install-cmd and running "composer install --no-scripts  --no-interaction" there.

Am I missing something or is this something that should be addressed as a bug?

comment.body:
Try setting the composer file to:

```
"simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp": "^2.1.0-rc1",
```

issue.title: Composer install does not install simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-assets-base
issue.body:
I have installed SimpleSAMLphp 2.1rc1 on a Drupal installation with dependencies managed via composer. 

I have the following in the root composer.json

        "simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp": "*",
        "simplesamlphp/composer-module-installer": "*",
        "simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-assets-base": "*",

The first composer install command does not install assets/base/* into the public folder. This however gets installed when you run composer install the second time.

I was able to work around this by using a composer post-install-cmd and running "composer install --no-scripts" there.

Am I missing something or is this something that should be addressed as a bug?

issue.title: Error Installing 2.1RC
issue.body:
I'm working in a local docker development environment, testing an upgrade to Drupal 10. When trying to actually perform the upgrade, I get the following error, which seems to be related to this code:

`Unable to install module simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-assets-base, package name must be on the form "VENDOR/simplesamlphp-module-MODULENAME".`

I believe this error is being generated by composer v2.

comment.body: @safetypins - Delete the vendors folder and try installing again.

issue.title: Error Installing 2.1RC
issue.body:
I'm working in a local docker development environment, testing an upgrade to Drupal 10. When trying to actually perform the upgrade, I get the following error, which seems to be related to this code:

`Unable to install module simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-assets-base, package name must be on the form "VENDOR/simplesamlphp-module-MODULENAME".`

I believe this error is being generated by composer v2.

comment.body: Then maybe an in-place upgrade is not the best approach for you.. Hard to tell, since I have zero knowledge of Drupal.

issue.title: Error Installing 2.1RC
issue.body:
I'm working in a local docker development environment, testing an upgrade to Drupal 10. When trying to actually perform the upgrade, I get the following error, which seems to be related to this code:

`Unable to install module simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-assets-base, package name must be on the form "VENDOR/simplesamlphp-module-MODULENAME".`

I believe this error is being generated by composer v2.

comment.body: It doesn't appear that I am able to upgrade that component separately. There's a cascade effect of dependencies that require several things, including simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp to be upgraded to the 2.1 RC at the same time as Drupal 10. Drupal 9.5 (the version I'm currently on) requires `psr/log:^1.1` and the 2.1.0-rc version of this library requires `psr/log:^3.0`.

issue.title: Error Installing 2.1RC
issue.body:
I'm working in a local docker development environment, testing an upgrade to Drupal 10. When trying to actually perform the upgrade, I get the following error, which seems to be related to this code:

`Unable to install module simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-assets-base, package name must be on the form "VENDOR/simplesamlphp-module-MODULENAME".`

I believe this error is being generated by composer v2.

comment.body: Try upgrading `simplesamlphp/composer-module-installer` prior to upgrading SimpleSAMLphp.

issue.title: Nullcheck to prevent exception being thrown when attribute is null in StatisticsWithAttribute
issue.body:
I've been having an exception thrown - and am adding a null check to overcome it. Perhaps not the best way to address this, but I'm just making an issue to add it as a Pull Request in case it is helpful to others.

Line 48 of simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp/modules/core/src/Auth/Process/StatisticsWithAttribute.php

`Invalid attribute name given to core:StatisticsWithAttribute filter.`

issue.title: Nullcheck to prevent exception being thrown when attribute is null in StatisticsWithAttribute
issue.body:
I've been having an exception thrown - and am adding a null check to overcome it. Perhaps not the best way to address this, but I'm just making an issue to add it as a Pull Request in case it is helpful to others.

Line 48 of simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp/modules/core/src/Auth/Process/StatisticsWithAttribute.php

`Invalid attribute name given to core:StatisticsWithAttribute filter.`

comment.body: You're right, apologies - this is in code that has already been refactored. My composer was pinning an old dev version of this module - closing.

issue.title: Nullcheck to prevent exception being thrown when attribute is null in StatisticsWithAttribute
issue.body:
I've been having an exception thrown - and am adding a null check to overcome it. Perhaps not the best way to address this, but I'm just making an issue to add it as a Pull Request in case it is helpful to others.

Line 48 of simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp/modules/core/src/Auth/Process/StatisticsWithAttribute.php

`Invalid attribute name given to core:StatisticsWithAttribute filter.`

comment.body: I'm not sure I follow.. You're using the `core:StatisticsWithAttribute` filter, but your haven't configured the `attributename`?
